item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "The cat does not offer services. The cat offers itself. Of course he wants care and shelter. You don't buy love for nothing." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors for you where there were only walls." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Cat hate reflects an ugly, stupid, loutish, bigoted spirit. There can be no compromise with this Ugly Spirit." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "If the path before you is clear, you're probably on someone else's." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Cam add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The big question is whether you are going to be able to say a hearty yes to your adventure " -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Cam add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The fates lead him who will; him who won't they drag." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "If I had my way we'd sleep every night all wrapped around each other like hibernating rattlesnakes." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "I am not one of those weak-spirited, sappy Americans who want to be liked by all the people around them. I donâ€™t care if people hate my guts; I assume most of them do. The important question is whether they are in a position to do anything about it. My affections, being concentrated over a few people, are not spread all over Hell in a vile attempt to placate sulky, worthless shits." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Language is a virus from outer space" -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Smash the control images. Smash the control machine." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Like all pure creatures, cats are practical." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A cat's rage is beautiful, burning with pure cat flame, all its hair standing up and crackling blue sparks, eyes blazing and sputtering." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "There is in fact something obscene and sinister about photography, a desire to imprison, to incorporate, a sexual intensity of pursuit." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "The cat does not offer services. The cat offers itself." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Like most qualities, cuteness is delineated by what it isn't. Most people aren't cute at all, or if so they quickly outgrow their cuteness ... Elegance, grace, delicacy, beauty, and a lack of self-consciousness: a creature who knows he is cute soon isn't." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Sometimes paranoia's just having all the facts." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "I prefer cats to people, for the most part. Most people aren't cute, & if they are cute they rapidly outgrow it" -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Evidence indicates that cats were first tamed in Egypt. The Egyptians stored grain, which attracted rodents, which attracted cats. (No evidence that such a thing happened with the Mayans, though a number of wild cats are native to the area.) I don't think this is accurate. It is certainly not the whole story. Cats didn't start as mousers. Weasels and snakes and dogs are more efficient as rodent-control agents. I postulate that cats started as psychic companions, as Familiars, and have never deviated from this function." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description:
"May 4, 1985. I am packing for a short trip to New York to discuss the cat book with Brion. In the front room where the kittens are kept, Calico Jane is nursing one black kitten. I pick up my Tourister. It seems heavy. I look inside and there are her other four kittens.
"Take care of my babies. Take them with you wherever you go." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "And there are my cats, engaged in a ritual that goes back thousands of years, tranquilly licking themselves after the meal. Practical animals, they prefer to have others provide the food ... some of them do. There must have been a split between the cats who accepted domestication and those who did not." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Cam add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cam add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cam add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you liked being a teenager, there's something really wrong with you." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cam add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Cats were the gangsters of the animal world, living outside the law and often dying there. There were a great many of them who never grew old by the fire." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cam add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "A cat won't curry favor even if it's in their best interests to do so. A cat can't be a hypocrite. If more preachers were like cats, this would be a more religious country." -- Stephen King

item.title: Cam add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "You don't take your cat with you to go bird shopping. Not because the cat isn't polite, but because he's a cat." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Cam add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Cam add a quote by Terry Pratchett
Cam add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What's your name,' Coraline asked the cat. 'Look, I'm Coraline. Okay?' 'Cats don't have names,' it said. 'No?' said Coraline. 'No,' said the cat. 'Now you people have names. That's because you don't know who you are. We know who we are, so we don't need names." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Cam add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I would like to see anyone, prophet, king or God, convince a thousand cats to do the same thing at the same time." -- Neil Gaiman
